newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Markets won't be allowed to destroy EMU - Juncker.
newsitem.headline: Markets won't be allowed to destroy EMU - Juncker.

text.p: The European Union will not allow financial markets to disrupt momentum towards a single currency, Luxembourg Prime Minister Jean-Claude Juncker said on Wednesday.
"We will not let the financial markets destroy monetary union...at the last stage," Juncker told reporters as he arrived for a "summit" of EU Christian Democrat leaders in Brussels.

Juncker was responding to reporters' questions on EU moves to prevent market speculation from derailing the planned euro during the period after the decision on which countries will participate, expected in early May 1998, and the launch date, January 1, 1999.
Luxembourg, which assumes the EU presidency in July, has said it will push quickly to set "indicative" exchange rates for national currencies against the single currency.
A growing number of experts say the most effective way to give markets stability ahead of 1999 is to reaffirm the central parity rates within Europe's Exchange Rate Mechanism.
